definitions.title: Informative Writing
definitions.definition: A style of writing that provides factual and objective information to educate the reader about a specific topic.
definitions.example: Example: Writing an essay about the process of photosynthesis.
definitions.explanation: Informative writing focuses on facts and explanations rather than opinions or persuasion.

definitions.title: Functions of an Informative Essay
definitions.definition: An informative essay aims to analyze, compare, and educate readers about facts and concepts.
definitions.example: Example: An essay comparing renewable and non-renewable energy sources.
definitions.explanation: It focuses on presenting knowledge clearly without convincing the reader to take a side.

definitions.title: Outline
definitions.definition: A plan or framework that organizes main ideas and supporting details before writing an essay.
definitions.explanation: An outline helps writers arrange their thoughts logically and ensures essay coherence.

definitions.title: Accurate Facts
definitions.definition: Information that is true, correct, and verifiable from reliable sources.
definitions.example: Example: Water boils at 100¬∞C under normal conditions.
definitions.explanation: Accuracy builds credibility and trust in informative writing.

definitions.title: Parts of an Essay
definitions.definition: The three main parts of an essay are the introduction, body, and conclusion.
definitions.example: Example: The introduction introduces the topic, the body explains it, and the conclusion summarizes the ideas.
definitions.explanation: Each part has a unique purpose that contributes to the essay‚Äôs clarity and completeness.

definitions.title: Body of an Essay
definitions.definition: The section that presents and explains the main ideas of the essay with supporting evidence.
definitions.example: Example: The body paragraph explaining the causes and effects of climate change.
definitions.explanation: It contains the important ideas and details that support the main topic.

definitions.title: Characteristics of an Essay
definitions.definition: An essay has a purpose, is organized into paragraphs, and has three main parts.
definitions.example: Example: An essay that informs readers about the importance of recycling.
definitions.explanation: Essays express organized thoughts and are written with a clear purpose.

definitions.title: Pre-Writing Stage
definitions.definition: The stage before writing that involves choosing a topic, researching, and organizing ideas.
definitions.example: Example: Listing facts about renewable energy before writing the essay.
definitions.explanation: Pre-writing helps the writer gather ideas and information to build a solid essay structure.

definitions.title: Introduction
definitions.definition: The opening part of an essay that introduces the main idea and captures the reader‚Äôs interest.
definitions.example: Example: 'Pollution is one of the most pressing problems in today‚Äôs world.'
definitions.explanation: It provides background and presents the topic clearly without examples or conclusions.

definitions.title: Facts vs. Opinions
definitions.definition: Facts are statements that can be proven true, while opinions are personal beliefs or judgments.
definitions.example: Example: Fact ‚Äì The Earth orbits the Sun. Opinion ‚Äì The Sun is the most beautiful star.
definitions.explanation: Informative essays rely on facts, not personal opinions, to maintain objectivity.

definitions.title: Research
definitions.definition: The process of collecting reliable information to support the ideas presented in the essay.
definitions.example: Example: Using scientific journals and books to write an essay on climate change.
definitions.explanation: Research strengthens the essay by providing credible evidence for every claim.

definitions.title: Paragraph
definitions.definition: A group of sentences arranged in a logical order that discusses one idea or topic.
definitions.example: Example: A paragraph explaining the benefits of reading daily.
definitions.explanation: Paragraphs organize ideas and help the essay flow smoothly.

definitions.title: Editing
definitions.definition: The final step in writing an essay where the writer checks grammar, spelling, and organization.
definitions.example: Example: Revising sentences to correct errors and improve clarity.
definitions.explanation: Editing ensures the essay is polished, error-free, and ready to submit.
